posts.post_content: They printed Bloodbraid Elves as a 3/2 **Haste** Cascade yet they couldn't print this as an instant? That is some shit. My Bituminous Blasts frequently Cascade into Grixis Charms/Terminates/Maelstrom Pulses, and that is an easy two for one instant, so I don't see the problem here. Weak, dedicated lifelink is paltry. Having cascade is nice but worthless if it isn't an instant. Don't let anyone say that lifegain in positive forms such as lifelink sucks, as it can totally hose the win-con's of many otherwise potent decks in a slow war of attrition, but this just shows the worst side of lifegain and why it gets all the hate from 'pro' players. Instant or get the hell out.
posts.html:

Having cascade is nice but worthless if it isn't an instant. Don't let anyone say that lifegain in positive forms such as lifelink sucks, as it can totally hose the win-con's of many otherwise potent decks in a slow war of attrition, but this just shows the worst side of lifegain and why it gets all the hate from 'pro' players. Instant or get the hell out.

Posted By: sportgenius (5/4/2009 11:57:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In the article "*Getting to Know Cascade*" it's even stated that this was planned to be an instant that provides three life at first, but was changed later since it was apparently too anoying when used against attacking creatures by fetching [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring)s or [Kitchen Finks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kitchen Finks).  
I'd have like this more as an instant, though. It has cc4 and therefore you could not really rely on always getting the right card unless you run a quite slow deck with no cards that cost 2 or less.

Posted By: DacenOctavio (11/7/2010 10:26:42 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I read that article. Their argument for keeping [Bituminous Blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bituminous Blast) Instant seemed a bit weak, especially considering what *that* can cascade into. [Bituminous Blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bituminous Blast), [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf), [Blightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightning), and wait a second who's really attacking here anyway? "Fun"? How is making 80% of the format Jund "fun"?  
  
I think they could've taken away the Instant speed and still kept this a winner if they just reduced its casting cost to ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol), giving people more control over what cards they might cascade into. If Captured Sunlight could reliably cascade into [Sigil Blessing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil Blessing) or [Crystallization](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystallization) I think people would be okay with it as a Sorcery. Note that even if it does cascade into Crystallization it's still not usually as good as [Faith's Fetters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faith's Fetters).
posts.html:
I read that article. Their argument for keeping Bituminous Blast Instant seemed a bit weak, especially considering what that can cascade into. Bituminous Blast, Bloodbraid Elf, Blightning, and wait a second who's really attacking here anyway? "Fun"? How is making 80% of the format Jund "fun"?

I think they could've taken away the Instant speed and still kept this a winner if they just reduced its casting cost to , giving people more control over what cards they might cascade into. If Captured Sunlight could reliably cascade into Sigil Blessing or Crystallization I think people would be okay with it as a Sorcery. Note that even if it does cascade into Crystallization it's still not usually as good as Faith's Fetters.

posts.post_content: I don't really get the rage against this card. I have two in my exalted deck, and I cascade into a Rhox War Monk more times than I can mention. Admittedly, 4 life isn't particularly good, but the War Monk will almost certainly get me more. I don't think this card is for everyone, surely, but it has actually won me several games, despite its unimpressive appearance. 3/5.
